text.p: These are the leading stories in the Algerian press on Sunday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Ain Defla province governor encourages peasants to arm themselves to ward off "terrorist" attacks. More than 40 villagers were slaughtered by "terrorists" in Matmata, in Ain Defla, south of Algiers, last week.
- Bomb explodes on train linking Algiers to the western town of Oran, causing no casualties.
- Security forces kill a "dangerous terrorist" in Medea province, south of Algiers.
- National Liberation Front postpones central committee meeting until after the local elections planned for October 23.
- Political parties, three months away from the local elections, were still awaiting the government to disburse promised state subsidies for the June 5 general elections.
- The government programme will be debated at ministers' council today before being presented to the National Assembly.
